title: Succoth, from The Seven Festivals
marks: Signature and Edition LRC, in pencil: [SHARIR]
text:
"Mark, on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the yield of your landâ€¦You shall live in booths seven days."
(Leviticus 23:39, 42)

"The sukkah forms the makeshift harvest dwelling.  Plain on the outside and within, bejeweled with decorations, fruits and the glow of sun during the day and the moon at night.  The family celebrates with lulav, willow, myrtle and ethrog.  A meal of fish is a foretaste of the Great Fish promised in Gan Eden to all the righteous of this world.  Sharing the sukkah are the ancient guests (ushpizin)."

Text from The Seven Festivals portfolio
description: stylized figures; flat bright color planes; decorative patterns; family at a table at bottom, with a woman serving a fish; 7 figures at top; stylized blue and pink fish in background
